context: Why is there two usb cords?
response: The Vengeance has a USB port to connect another USB peripheral like a mouse or headset. But powering the second device requires connecting the second USB cord (called the USB pass-through, I think). However, this mainly makes the second USB port only useful if the second device has too short a cord to connect to the computer directly.

context: How does the pro controller connect to the gamepad
response: The Wii U Pro Controller does not connect to anything but the console through the special mini-USB controller adapter, and that's mainly if you want to recharge the controller and use it while it's recharging. context: What is its storage size?
response: i dont know sorry

context: does the wii u have  a hdmi port to play instead of the red white an yellow wires
response: Yes, it has both ports, hdmi and component

context: i dont know how to program my controller it never came with instructions
response: there should have been a white sheet of paper in the box with codes on it

context: Is a joystick needed?
response: No, I use a Thrustmaster Top Gun Joystick and throttle.

context: Will the game support a Logitech F310 gamepad, combined with a 2Ghz/Win7/D-Core/4Gb ram/Directx-11 environment? 2nd: Plz confirm NO "Steam".
response: Make sure your D-Core is at least 2.4 GHz. That's part of the requirements to run it.

context: Does this connect more than 1 controller or do I need to buy multiple one?
response: Confirmed 4 controllers connected last night.

context: is it compatible with windows 8.1
response: Im not sure because im running windows 7, I don't use mine though because when I received it, it did not work so I ended up buying the Razor Naga and im extremely happy with it.

context: Will this program run on the XP system
response: Yes, ive down load it before on xp and it works fine as long as you have enough RAM and the video card can support gaming.

context: can you play this game solo?
response: yep.  it's a building game.  meant to be played solo.  need a middle scroll wheel though.  the idiot designers didn't allow for any other type of zoom control and you can't even get past the tutorial without using it.

context: online multi player training works good but regular game play is slooooow motion whats wrong?
response: We don't play it online, but sometimes it is really slow. Sorry, I don't have a clue. Perhaps your internet speed slowed down? Good luck finding the answer.

context: Can you list the track locations -- other than the Daytona, Sonoma, Talladega?
response: All the racetracks that the races take place are in the game. Phoenix, Bristol, Indianapolis, etc.

context: where do the gamecube controllers connect to the wii
response: On one of the narrow sides there is a flap that swings open. It has four Gamecube controller ports and two memory card ports.Example Image Link:http://www.product-reviews.net/wp-content/uploads/new-nintendo-wii-confirmed-slimmer-and-smaller-not-all-good-news-2.jpg

context: What size jack does it have? I've tried every headset in the store with a 3.5mm jack and it doesn't fit my tablet or Nintendo 3ds xl.
response: I'm pretty sure this has a 3.5 jack too

context: does it already have all the update patches
response: I don't know. If you get an older copy, you will need to DL patches. If you get a newer made disk, you may not.

context: Is this game compatible with an Xbox 360 controller? Many PC games are.
response: I actually think it's required. Not 100% sure on that, but I can confirm I use a controller with it.

context: I noticed that one reviewer mentioned the battery pack also needs to be purchased. Doesn't this take AA batteries like the old controllers?
response: Yes, it comes with batteries like the old one....the other reviewer probably was talking about the rechargeable pack that is sold separately.

context: Is this made in China?
response: Yes, it is. But the quality is much better than the typical made in china stuff that falls apart in days. In comparison, i recently ordered an ipad mini, which was backordered. When i finally got shipping details it was coming from china. The keyboard has been working flawlesly for me and feels like it will last years.

context: What's the privacy cover for?
response: So that if you wish for the camera on the kinect not be able to see you you can put it on. The camera is always on if the kinect is on and sees the whole room.

context: is this a digital download for xbox 360? i wanna play today, but i dont wanna wait for shipping.
response: No this was not a digital download.

context: Is this game 3rd person only?
response: It is only 3rd person.

context: Do you need wifi to play?  I know you need it to download... But is it needed to actually play the games?
response: The pack is played through steam so you'll need to have an account with them first before downloading the game. All of this requires an internet connection but to actually play the games there should be an offline mode in steam's settings.

context: rumble pad work on 64 bit vista???? Can these things work on the 64 bit vista program, and if not, which game pad does?????
response: It works fine with Win7 x64, and I've found that most drivers are compatible between Vista & 7, so... probably.

context: can i download this edition
response: yup = insert c d start and presto your allset for a battle with your choice of difficulty. GoodluckGene in Minnesota

context: What is the shipping weight and size?
response: I can't give you exact figures as I trashed the packaging years ago, but the Size is about as big as a Large paperback book but Much Lighter.

context: will it take a rumble pack?
response: No, it will not.

context: Does it work well with the XBOX 360?
response: It's actually an XBOX 360 controller that simply comes with a Wireless adapter to work with your PC. It will function as normal with a 360.
